job_title: Head Tennis Coach in Dubuque, IA
cons: Private institution, makes for a difficulty in giving scholarships

review_title: Fair pay but job support from the department was sorely lacking
pros: 1. Fair pay and compensation 2. Administration support was terrific 3. Students were a joy to work with
cons: Department chair was very unprofessional. Department members were few and very cliquish, unwelcoming and practiced gossiping, rumor mongering, and back stabbing. This made for a toxic work environment.

pros: Lots of possible flight time. Glass cockpit brand new aircraft.
cons: Revolving door, so quality of life of instructors really doesn't change. You get in and you get out as quickly as you can.

review_title: Good way to build community and meet others on campus.
pros: Free room and board and monthly stipend
cons: A good amount of time and effort put in. Less freedom in college.

job_title: Student Engagement Coordinator in Dubuque, IA
cons: I have no cons to share.

pros: Dedicated faculty and staff. Beautiful facility.
Competitive Pay, Best airplanes for training
cons: You do only get paid once a month

pros: Over 6 weeks paid time off, Good Wages, Friendly atmosphere, extra paid days off around the holidays given by President Bullock, Multiple Shifts available
Working with students, especially the under-served.
cons: They don't operate in a rational, "business normal" manner

job_title: Assistant Women's Soccer Coach in Dubuque, IA

review_title: Good compensation compared to other flight instruction jobs
pros: As a pilot and flight instructor, you are compensated well in comparison to other flight schools in the country. The University of Dubuque offers both an hourly wage and salary on top of that, as a full-time employee.They offer a full benefits package as well, not usually found at other flight schools. New airplanes, new(er) simulators.
cons: During summer students are few and far between, pay is not as great as it is in the Fall/Spring semesters. Health insurance is expensive.

review_title: Student Worker in Campus Convenience Store
pros: Well-scheduled hours around classes, athletics, and workouts. Students are encouraged to do homework while working if there are no customers.
cons: 80 hour limit per four weeks of working. If a student wants to work more and the schedule allows, (for example picking up shifts) he/she should be able to. Also the pay period is monthly, and you get paid on the second Friday so paying rent and other college expenses can be difficult.

pros:
Probably one of the best student worker jobs on campus. 
Easy going
Friendly
Fun place to work
Very Flexible to work with
cons: The pay isn't very good, however, for a student worker job it is good. There isn't really any opportunity to advance.

review_title: Working for the CRWC as a Graphic Designer
pros: The Chlapaty Recreation and Wellness Center provided full creative freedom, great hours for a part-time job, Vic and Jose are awesome people to work for and make a fun work environment.
cons: Didn't always know what they wanted, but that's what to expect when working with clients.

job_title: Assistant Director of Financial Aid in Dubuque, IA
pros: Diverse responsibilities and opportunity to work one-on-one counseling/advising 90% of our student body in Financial Aid options, as well as other curriculum advice.
cons: Need a position that will utilize more of my education obtained while at UD (2 undergrads, 1 masters degree).

job_title: Head Cheerleading Coach in Dubuque, IA
pros: Decent salary for a cheerleading coach; friend people; team-orienated; let you coach your own program and make decisions for your program.
cons: Leadership was lacking; not many group meeting for coaches; needed a seminar for new hires.

job_title: Federal Work Study in Dubuque, IA
pros: Plenty of opportunities throughout the campus to make money
cons: Minimum wage and different work hours
